facts: A galaxy is a huge collection of stars, gas, dust, and dark matter held together by gravity.
Our Solar System is inside the Milky Way galaxy, which contains hundreds of billions of stars.
Galaxies come in different shapes, including spiral, elliptical, and irregular forms.
The Andromeda Galaxy is the nearest large galaxy to the Milky Way and is on a slow collision course with it.
Many galaxies have a supermassive black hole at their center that can be millions or billions of times the Sunâ€™s mass.
Because light takes time to travel, looking at distant galaxies lets us see what the universe was like long ago.
Galaxies often gather into groups and clusters, and the space between them is not completely empty but filled with hot gas and faint matter.
